title: How to Clear the Cache on Your Xbox

steps.title: Scroll across to the system tab and select the storage devices option.
steps.content: Scroll across to the system tab and select the storage devices option.

steps.title: Highlight the hard drive or memory unit option (it should say "Hard Drive, 12 GB free", for example).
steps.content: Highlight the hard drive or memory unit option (it should say "Hard Drive, 12 GB free", for example).

steps.title: Select "Clear System Cache".
steps.content: Select "Clear System Cache". The following message should appear: "This will perform maintenance on your Xbox 360 storage device. Do you want to continue?"

steps.title: Restart your console.
steps.content: Restart your console. You have now cleared your hard drive cache and your Xbox 360 should run faster and have improved game-play on certain games (The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim, Fallout 3, Halo 3, or other games).

steps.title: When it is starting up, hold down A.
steps.content: When it is starting up, hold down A .

steps.title: This will clear all patches.
steps.content: This will clear all patches. The Xbox should run faster and have improved gameplay.
